Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: The Wage and Hour Division announced that Restaurant Associates and its subcontractor, Personnel Plus, would pay $1,008,302 in back wages to 674 workers employed in U.S. Senate cafeterias. The division found the two employers violated the McNamara-O'Hara Service Contract Act when they improperly classified workers paying them for lower-paying jobs than they actually performed and required employees to work prior to their scheduled starting times without compensation. Paying below the required rates also caused the companies to fail to pay the workers overtime at the proper rates.
Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: https://www.dol.gov/newsroom/releases/whd/whd20160726

Description: The New York Attorney General announced an $18 million settlement with food management services provider Compass Group USA, Inc. concerning allegations it overcharged more than 39 New York schools and school districts statewide. Compass was said to have received discounts from food vendors but did not pass on those savings to New York's schools, as required by law.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20160820124702/http://ag.ny.gov/press-release/ag-schneiderman-announces-18-million-settlement-compass-group-usa-overcharging-nys-7
